t: Jeremiah 48
Prophecy against Moab

Concerning*p Moab. Thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel, “Woe*pn to Nebo, for it has been destroyed; Kiriathaim*ln has been put to shame, it has been captured; The*ln lofty stronghold has been put to shame and shattered.

There*ln is praise for Moab no longer; In*ln Heshbon they have devised calamity against her: ‘Come*ln and let us cut her off from being*i a nation!’ You*ln too, Madmen, will be silenced; The*ln sword will follow after you.
The*ln sound of an outcry from Horonaim, ‘Devastation*ln and great destruction!’
Moab*ln is broken, Her*ln little ones have sounded out a cry of*i distress.*i
For*ln by the ascent of Luhith They*ln will ascend with continual weeping; For*ln at the descent of Horonaim They*ln have heard the anguished cry of destruction.
Flee,*ln save your lives, That*ln you may be like a juniper in the wilderness.
For*ln because of your trust in your own achievements and treasures, Even*ln you yourself will be captured; And*ln Chemosh will go off into exile Together*ln with his priests and his princes.
A*ln destroyer will come to every city, So*ln that no city will escape; The*ln valley also will be ruined And*ln the plateau will be destroyed, As*ln the Lord*s has said.
Give*ln wings to Moab, For*ln she will flee away; And*ln her cities will become a desolation, Without*ln inhabitants in them.
Cursed*ln be the one who does the Lord’s*s work negligently, And*ln cursed be the one who restrains his sword from blood.

“Moab*ln has been at ease since his youth; He*ln has also been undisturbed, like*i wine*i on its dregs, And*ln he has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, Nor*ln has he gone into exile. Therefore*ln he retains his flavor, And*ln his aroma has not changed.
Therefore*p behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when I will send to him those who tip vessels,*i and they will tip him over, and they will empty his vessels and shatter his jars.
And Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
How*pn can you say, ‘We are mighty warriors, And*ln men valiant for battle’?
Moab*ln has been destroyed and men have gone up to his cities; His*ln choicest young men have also gone down to the slaughter,” Declares*ln the King, whose name is the Lord*s of hosts.
“The*ln disaster of Moab will soon come, And*ln his calamity has swiftly hastened.
Mourn*ln for him, all you who live*i around him, Even*ln all of you who know his name; Say,*ln ‘How has the mighty scepter been broken, A*ln staff of splendor!’
Come*ln down from your glory And*ln sit on the parched ground, O*ln daughter dwelling in Dibon, For*ln the destroyer of Moab has come up against you, He*ln has ruined your strongholds.
Stand*ln by the road and keep watch, O*ln inhabitant of Aroer; Ask*ln him who flees and her who escapes And*iln say, ‘What has happened?’
Moab*ln has been put to shame, for it has been shattered. Wail*ln and cry out; Declare*ln by the Arnon That*ln Moab has been destroyed.
“Judgment*p has also come upon the plain, upon Holon, Jahzah and against Mephaath,
against Dibon, Nebo and Beth-diblathaim,
against Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul and Beth-meon,
against Kerioth, Bozrah and all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.
The horn of Moab has been cut off and his arm broken,” declares the Lord.*s
“Make him drunk, for he has become arrogant toward the Lord;*s so Moab will wallow in his vomit, and he also will become a laughingstock.
Now was not Israel a laughingstock to you? Or was he caught among thieves? For each time you speak about him you shake your*i head*i in*i scorn.*i
Leave*pn the cities and dwell among the crags, O*ln inhabitants of Moab, And*ln be like a dove that nests Beyond*ln the mouth of the chasm.
We*ln have heard of the pride of Moab—he is*i very proud— Of*ln his haughtiness, his pride, his arrogance and his self-exaltation.
I*ln know his fury,” declares the Lord,*s “But*ln it is futile; His*ln idle boasts have accomplished nothing.
Therefore*ln I will wail for Moab, Even*ln for all Moab will I cry out; I*ln will moan for the men of Kir-heres.

More*ln than the weeping for Jazer I*ln will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah! Your*ln tendrils stretched across the sea, They*ln reached to the sea of Jazer; Upon*ln your summer fruits and your grape harvest The*ln destroyer has fallen.

So*ln gladness and joy are taken away From*ln the fruitful field, even from the land of Moab. And*ln I have made the wine to cease from the wine presses; No*ln one will tread them*i with shouting, The*ln shouting will not be shouts of*i joy.*i
From*p the outcry at Heshbon even to Elealeh, even to Jahaz they have raised their voice, from Zoar even to Horonaim and*i to*i Eglath-shelishiyah; for even the waters of Nimrim will become desolate.
I will make an end of Moab,” declares the Lord,*s “the one who offers sacrifice*i on the high place and the one who burns incense to his gods.
“Therefore*p My heart wails for Moab like flutes; My heart also wails like flutes for the men of Kir-heres. Therefore they have lost the abundance it produced.
For every head is bald and every beard cut short; there are gashes on all the hands and sackcloth on the loins.
On all the housetops of Moab and in its streets there is lamentation everywhere; for I have broken Moab like an undesirable vessel,” declares the Lord.*s
“How shattered it is! How*i they have wailed! How Moab has turned his back—he is ashamed! So Moab will become a laughingstock and an object of terror to all around him.”
For*pn thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*ln one will fly swiftly like an eagle And*ln spread out his wings against Moab.
Kerioth*ln has been captured And*ln the strongholds have been seized, So*ln the hearts of the mighty men of Moab in that day Will*ln be like the heart of a woman in labor.
Moab*ln will be destroyed from being*i a people Because*ln he has become arrogant toward the Lord.*s
Terror,*ln pit and snare are coming*i upon you, O*ln inhabitant of Moab,” declares the Lord.*s

“The*ln one who flees from the terror Will*ln fall into the pit, And*ln the one who climbs up out of the pit Will*ln be caught in the snare; For*ln I shall bring upon her, even*i upon Moab, The*ln year of their punishment,” declares the Lord.*s

“In*ln the shadow of Heshbon The*ln fugitives stand without strength; For*ln a fire has gone forth from Heshbon And*ln a flame from the midst of Sihon, And*ln it has devoured the forehead of Moab And*ln the scalps of the riotous revelers.
Woe*ln to you, Moab! The*ln people of Chemosh have perished; For*ln your sons have been taken away captive And*ln your daughters into captivity.
Yet*ln I will restore the fortunes of Moab In*ln the latter days,” declares the Lord.*s Thus*bp far the judgment on Moab.
